item.title: Strong smell of urine around Foch statue, 6th July
item.description:
Lots of cigarette butts, urine and other spillages around the Ferndinand Foch statue. Needs a deep clean as it is not very pleasant for those entering and leaving the park

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buckingham Palace Road, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Street is a mess

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter strewn across the pavement, 6th July
item.description:
This is the 3rd time of me having to rep[ort this. If it happens again I will write a formal complaint letter to Southwark Council Environmental Services. The litter is swept up by a council worker on a Saturday (yesterday 05/07/25) The blue bags are then left on the top of the litter bin. Because the bags are not collected on the same day, the foxes pull the bags down and rip them open, leaving litter all over the pavement (see photo!). The men did come today (Sunday) to collect but just picked up the bags and left all the litter on the streets, what kind of worker does that, its totally lazy. I presume they get paid for this! I am a council tax payer and one of the many that pay their wages! As I sate this will be the last time I note it on this site!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 135, Melbourne Grove, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees obscuring road signs, 6th July
item.description:
I have included Google map pictures of the road signs that are not easily visible from the road while driving. Google map pictures were taken when the trees aren’t in full leaf. The road is the A20 (coming towards London) just before and on the slip road coming down to the Crittals corner roundabout. There is also overgrown vegetation’s encroaching onto the roundabout as you turn left at Crittals corner roundabout onto the Sevenoaks Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup By-pass, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scrubbs Cottages off Whitebeam Ave Nitrous Oxide cans dumped, 6th July
item.description:
Early am 6/7/25 Three large aerosol cans 650g used for illegal inhalation of Nitrous Oxide have been dumped. Location: End of Whitebeam Ave/under street sign for Scrubbs Cottages just at start of footpath leading towards properties in Scrubbs Cottages. Can these cans be taken away please. This area does get used by persons using Nitrous Oxide. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A mass of leaves and weed growth now is tarting to affect the drains / pls clear, 6th July
item.description:
Elmwood road becuase of its position at the bottom of three roads that run into it collects a mass of leaves and organic matter . This gradually breaks down and start weed growth and potentially starts to block drains
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmwood Road, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bar expanding their outdoor area more and more, blocking the path between bench and road going east., 6th July
item.description:
This bar has slowly been increasing their area of the outside part. It was once confined to what was close to their restaurant, but they have now expanded so that to walk to the east part of upper ground from the path you have to walk around the long bench, unless you walk through their seating area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Stamford Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet
